articles.description: Today in science, on February 5, 1963, Maarten Schmidt unraveled the mystery of quasars and pushed back the edges of our cosmos. His insight into the most distant and luminous objects known has changed the way scientists view the universe.
articles.content:
Maarten Schmidt via Caltech.
Today in science: On February 5, 1963, Dutch astronomer and Caltech professor Maarten Schmidt had a eureka moment when studying a quasi-stellar radio source, or quasar, … [+6569 chars]
